jrigby.openstack_queue.request_templates

Class ThreeStageJobCallbackImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • jrigby.openstack_queue.request_templates.ThreeStageJobCallback
      • jrigby.openstack_queue.request_templates.ThreeStageJobCallbackImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ThreeStageJobInterface, ResourceProvisioningCallback

    public class ThreeStageJobCallbackImpl
extends ThreeStageJobCallback
    A full implementation of ThreeStageJobCallback where the three stages are supplied as String arguments for remote execution.
    Author:
    jason

    • Constructor Detail

      • ThreeStageJobCallbackImpl

        public ThreeStageJobCallbackImpl(java.lang.String bootstrapScript,
                         java.lang.String executeScript,
                         java.lang.String cleanupScript,
                         java.lang.String resultsPath,
                         java.io.File... payloadFiles)
        Parameters:
        bootstrapScript - the bootstrap script to execute
        executeScript - the main execution script to execute
        cleanupScript - the cleanup script to execute (run before results files are returned)
        resultsPath - path of the results files
        payloadFiles - path of the payload files to copy to the remote hosts

    • Method Detail

      • onFailure

        public boolean onFailure(java.lang.Throwable e)
        Called if the resources could not be created.
        Parameters:
        e - the exception that caused the request to fail
        Returns:
        true if the job is to be rescheduled (i.e. on a temporary failure) or false if the job is to be abandoned

      • bootstrap

        public void bootstrap(ServerCollection nodes)
        The bootstrap phase initially copies all payload files to the remote host. Then the custom script is executed.
        Parameters:
        nodes - allocated nodes

      • execute

        public void execute(ServerCollection nodes)
        The execute script is run
        Parameters:
        nodes - allocated nodes

      • cleanup

        public void cleanup(ServerCollection nodes)
        The custom cleanup script is first executed. Then, any results files are compressed and returned.
        Parameters:
        nodes - allocated nodes
